intro: Chaetolepis cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban chaetolepis, is a species of flowering plant native to Cuba. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and the presence of milky sap. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited geographic distribution.
